PhyMediumComments: black-and-white: Agfa Superpan Press safety film
CatDescriptText: Cutline of image published in Pittsburgh Courier newspaper, September 4, 1943, pg. 14, reads: "Elkdom on Parade! ... Thousands See Colorful Event ... Nation Represented. Tuesday afternoon, the Elks held their famous annual convention parade.  Up and down the hills of Pittsburgh marched the members of the Antlered Herd to the cheers and applause of thousands of spectators.  While not as long as parades in other years, it was still colorful and entertaining... 20. Marching Club of Washington, D. C., one of the crack units in parade. - Courier Photos by Harris, Sockwell and Olmstead."
TitMainTitle: Annual Elks parade, with members of Washington D. C. Elks club marching near Northside Elks Lodge No. 124, Wylie Avenue, Hill District
